metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6049 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect security UI in permissions prompt in Google Chrome prior to 64.0.3282.119 allowed a remote attacker to spoof the origin to which permission is granted via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
